panels.description: This dashboard displays satellite data (as both images and time series) along with environmental data (river discharge).

options.content:
### Directions for site navigation 

FIO-REACH sampling locations are shown on map at left

Green circles = REACH Biological Sampling

Red squares = OCG Subsurface Moorings

Yellow stars = OCG Surface Buoys

Rice's whale core habitat is represented by red polygon

Gray lines represent depth contours

Hover mouse over features on the map to see description

Select mean, climatology or anomaly using the "Time Series Metric" dropdown menu.

The range of the displayed time period can be adjusted at top right.

To view time series panels, simply click on the panel title (e.g. "Satellite Imagery" or "Satellite Time Series Extractions")

panels.title: Welcome to the FIO-REACH Project data dashboard

panels.description: VIIRS-SNPP 750-m chlorophyll-a concentration (mg/m^3) binned to 7-day intervals. Anomaly images are created by subtracting a 7-day climatology using data from 2013-2019.
panels.title: VIIRS-SNPP CHLa 7-Day anomaly images (mg/m^3)

panels.description: VIIRS-SNPP 750-m nighttime sea-surface temperature (DegC) binned to 7-day intervals. Anomaly images are created by subtracting a 7-day climatology using data from 2013-2019.
panels.title: VIIRS-SNPP 7-Day nighttime SST anomaly images (DegC)

panels.description: VIIRS-SNPP 750-m remote sensing reflectance (sr^-1) at 671nm binned to 7-day intervals. This is a proxy for suspended sediments at the surface. Anomaly images are created by subtracting a 7-day climatology using data from 2013-2019.
panels.title: VIIRS-SNPP remote sensing reflectance at 671nm 7-Day anomaly images (sr^-1)

panels.description: MODIS-Aqua 1-km Algal Bloom Index (mW cm^-2 um^-1 sr^-1) binned to 7-day intervals. This product can be used to identify algal blooms. Anomaly images are created by subtracting a 7-day climatology using data from 2003-2019.
panels.title: MODIS-Aqua Algal Bloom Index (ABI) 7-Day anomaly images (mW cm^-2 um^-1 sr^-1)

panels.description: Dynamic seascapes are classified using multivariate data and describe basin and gyre scale features and seasonal boundary shifts. A description of seascape classes can be found HERE.
panels.title: Dynamic biogeographic seascapes (class)

targets.query:
SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) as metric FROM "chlor_a"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND ("satellite" =~ /VSNPP/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) AS anomaly FROM "sstn"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND ("satellite" =~ /VSNPP/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) AS anomaly FROM "Rrs_671"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND ("satellite" =~ /VSNPP/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) AS anomaly FROM "Kd_490"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND ("satellite" =~ /VSNPP/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) AS anomaly FROM "ABI"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND ("satellite" =~ /MODA/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT /^$metric$/ FROM disch
WHERE (location = 'fk' AND $timeFilter )
GROUP BY "location" fill(null)

panels.title: USGS River Discharge from rivers draining to Everglades (sum of discharge from green dots on map - m^3/sec)

targets.query:
SELECT /^$metric$/ FROM disch
WHERE (location = 'EFL' AND $timeFilter )
GROUP BY "location" fill(null)

panels.title: USGS Gage Height from Tamiami Canal draining into Biscayne Bay (red circle on map - meters)

targets.query:
SELECT sea_water_temperature as sea_water_temperature FROM "salinity"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Buoy$/) AND $timeFilter AND sea_water_temperature > -999
GROUP BY "location" fill(null)

SELECT sea_water_practical_salinity as sea_water_practical_salinity FROM "salinity"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Buoy$/) AND $timeFilter AND sea_water_practical_salinity > -999
GROUP BY "location" fill(null)

options.content:
* Satellite data (Chlorophyll-a, SST and Rrs_667) is from the Visible Infrared Imaging Spectrometer Suite (VIIRS-SNPP) sensor and is obtained from the [Ocean Biology Processing Group](https://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/) at NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center.

* Rrs_667 represents reflectance at 667nm and is a proxy for suspended sediments.

* Algal Bloom Index (ABI) comes from the Moderate Resolution Spectroradiometer (MODIS-Aqua) and can be used to identify algal blooms. It is calculated using the method of Hu and Feng (2016; doi: 10.1117/1.JRS.11.012003) 

* River discharge data is obtained from the [USGS National Water Information System](https://waterdata.usgs.gov/nwis). Discharge values from the Shark, Broad, Lostmans and Chatham Rivers (green circles on map above) are summed to estimate discharge into the southern West Florida Shelf and plotted above. 

* In-situ temperature and salinity data ...

* Dynamic seascapes are classified using multivariate satellite data and describe basin and gyre scale features and seasonal boundary shifts. They are obtained from [NOAA's Coastwatch](https://cwcgom.aoml.noaa.gov/erddap/griddap/noaa_aoml_seascapes_8day.graph). A description of seascape classes can be found [HERE](https://shiny.marinebon.app/seascapes/classes.html).

Please feel free to contact us with questions or to sign up for email alerts:

Dr. Daniel Otis - [dotis@usf.edu](mailto:dotis@usf.edu)

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "chlor_a" WITH KEY = "location" WHERE "region" = 'REACH'
list.label: Satellite Time Series Extraction Locations
list.name: Locations
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "chlor_a" WITH KEY = "location" WHERE "region" = 'REACH'

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "salinity" WITH KEY = "location"
list.label: Buoy Locations
list.name: Buoy
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "salinity" WITH KEY = "location"
